intro: Smilax platoplis, commonly known as the red root vine, is a perennial climbing plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its woody stems and spiny, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into red, berry-like fruits. Smilax platoplis is often found in moist, wooded areas and is known for its medicinal properties. Its roots have been traditionally used in herbal remedies for their purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects.
